name: 陳錦文
objective: This course aims to study the spinning process of various natural and chemical fibers, explains the basic principles of spinning technology, and the differences and applications of different spinning technologies.
schedule:
Week 1 - Introduction to fiber 
Week 2 - Fiber structure and characteristic
Week 3 - Fiber spinning
Week 4 - Fluid flow during fiber spinning
Week 5 - Melt-spinning processes
Week 6 - Solution-spinning processing
Week 7 - Drawing of melt-spun fibers
Week 8 - Midterm exam
Week 9 - Heat-setting of thermoplastic fibers
Week 10 - Polye(ethylene terephthalate) fibers 
Week 11 - Polyamide 6 and 66 fibers 
Week 12 - Polyacrylonitrile fibers 
Week 13 - Polypropylene fibers　　
Week 14 - Bi-component spinning technique
Week 15 - Electrospinning technique
Week 16 - Final exam
materials:
1. Manufactured Fibre Technology  (https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-94-011-5854-1)
2. Advances in filament yarn spinning of textiles and polymers (https://www.sciencedirect.com/book/9780857094995/advances-in-filament-yarn-spinning-of-textiles-and-polymers )
3. Advanced Fiber Spinning Technology (https://www.sciencedirect.com/book/9781855731820/advanced-fiber-spinning-technology )
4. Structure Formation in Polymeric Fibers (https://www.hanser-elibrary.com/doi/10.3139/9783446456808 )
